qas.question: Why is Israel referred to as the 51st state?

answers.text: the annual funding and defense support it receives from the United States

qas.question: What book did Martine Rothblatt publish?
When was Two Stars for Peace published?
Who wrote the book The American State of Canaan?

plausible_answers.text: the annual funding and defense support it receives from the United States

qas.question: Why is Israel referred to as Canaan?
What book did Alfred de Grazia publish?
When was Alfred de Grazia supported by the United States?
Who wrote the book Martine Rothblatt?
What argued for the addition United States books?

context: Several websites assert that Israel is the 51st state due to <a0_0><b4_0>the annual funding and defense support it receives from the United States<b4_0/><a0_0/>. An example of this concept can be found in <a2_0><b6_0>2003<b6_0/><a2_0/> when Martine Rothblatt published a book called <a1_0><b5_0><b8_0>Two Stars for Peace<b8_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> that argued for the addition of Israel and the Palestinian territories surrounding it as the 51st state in the Union. The American State of Canaan, is a book published by Prof. <a3_0><b7_0>Alfred de Grazia<b7_0/><a3_0/>, political science and sociologist, in March 2009, proposing the creation of the 51st and 52nd states from Israel and the Palestinian territories.
